attribute.name: alwaysShowContainer
attribute.description: Always show the results container, instead of only showing when the user is requesting them.

attribute.name: applyLocalFilter
attribute.description: If set to true, the filterResults method will be run on the response from the data source.

attribute.name: autoHighlight
attribute.description: Automatically highlight the first item in the list when the results are made visible.

attribute.name: boundingBox
attribute.description: The outermost DOM node for the Widget, used for sizing and positioning of a Widget as well as a containing element for any decorator elements used for skinning.

attribute.name: button
attribute.description: To use a button

attribute.name: contentBox
attribute.description: A DOM node that is a direct descendent of a Widget's bounding box that houses its content.

attribute.name: cssClass
attribute.description: CSS class to be automatically added to the boundingBox.

attribute.name: dataSource
attribute.description: The data source that results will be read from. This can either be an existing DataSource object, or it can be a value that would be passed to DataSource.

attribute.name: dataSourceType
attribute.description: The type of the data source passed into dataSource. This can be used to explicitly declare what kind of DataSource object will be created.

attribute.name: delimChar
attribute.description: The character used to indicate the beginning or ending of a new value. Most commonly used is a ",".

attribute.name: destroyed
attribute.description: Flag indicating whether or not this object has been through the destroy lifecycle phase.

attribute.name: disabled
attribute.description: Boolean indicating if the Widget should be disabled. The disabled implementation is left to the specific classes extending widget.

attribute.name: focused
attribute.description: Boolean indicating if the Widget, or one of its descendants, has focus.

attribute.name: forceSelection
attribute.description: If typeAhead is true, this will clear a selection when the overlay closes unless a user explicitly selects an item.

attribute.name: height
attribute.description: String with units, or number, representing the height of the Widget. If a number is provided, the default unit, defined by the Widgets DEF_UNIT, property is used.

attribute.name: hideClass
attribute.description: css class added to hide the boundingBox when visible is set to false.

attribute.name: initialized
attribute.description: Flag indicating whether or not this object has been through the init lifecycle phase.

attribute.name: input
attribute.description: The input field which will recieve the users input.

attribute.name: matchKey
attribute.description: The key or numeric index in the schema to match the result against.

attribute.name: maxResultsDisplayed
attribute.description: The maximum number of results to display.

attribute.name: minQueryLength
attribute.description: The minimum number of characters required to query the data source.

attribute.name: queryDelay
attribute.description: The amount of time in seconds to delay before submitting the query.

attribute.name: queryInterval
attribute.description: When IME usage is detected or interval detection is explicitly enabled, AutoComplete will detect the input value at the given interval and send a query if the value has changed.

attribute.name: queryMatchCase
attribute.description: When applyLocalFilter is true, setting this to true will match only results with the same case.

attribute.name: queryMatchContains
attribute.description: When applyLocalFilter is true, setting this to true will match results which contain the query anywhere in the text, instead of just matching just items that start with the query.

attribute.name: queryQuestionMark
attribute.description: For IO DataSources, AutoComplete will automatically insert a "?" between the server URI and the encoded query string. To prevent this behavior, you can set this value to false. If you need to customize this even further, you can override the generateRequest method.

attribute.name: render
attribute.description: If true the render phase will be autimatically invoked preventing the .render() manual call.

attribute.name: rendered
attribute.description: Flag indicating whether or not this Widget has been through the render lifecycle phase.

attribute.name: schema
attribute.description: A valid configuration object for any of DataSource schema plugins.

attribute.name: schemaType
attribute.description: A valid type of DataSource schema plugin, such as array, json, xml, etc.

attribute.name: srcNode
attribute.description: The DOM node to parse for configuration values, passed to the Widget's HTML_PARSER definition

attribute.name: strings
attribute.description: Collection of strings used to label elements of the Widget's UI.

attribute.name: suppressInputUpdate
attribute.description: Whether or not the input field should be updated with selections.

attribute.name: tabIndex
attribute.description: Number (between -32767 to 32767) indicating the widget's position in the default tab flow. The value is used to set the "tabIndex" attribute on the widget's bounding box. Negative values allow the widget to receive DOM focus programmatically (by calling the focus method), while being removed from the default tab flow. A value of null removes the "tabIndex" attribute from the widget's bounding box.

attribute.name: typeAhead
attribute.description: If autoHighlight is enabled, whether or not the input field should be automatically updated with the first result as the user types, automatically selecting the portion of the text the user has not typed yet.

attribute.name: typeAheadDelay
attribute.description: If typeAhead is true, number of seconds to delay before updating the input. In order to prevent certain race conditions, this value must always be greater than the queryDelay.

attribute.name: uniqueName
attribute.description: The unique ID of the input element.

attribute.name: buttons
attribute.description:
Array of object literals, each containing a set of properties defining a button to be appended into the Dialog's footer. Each button object in the buttons array can have two properties:

text:
The text that will display on the face of the button. The text can include HTML, as long as it is compliant with HTML Button specifications.
handler:
A reference to a function that should fire when the button is clicked. (In this case scope of this function is always its Dialog instance.)

attribute.description: If true give stacking habilities to the Dialog.

attribute.name: strings
attribute.description: Collection of strings used to label elements of the Widget's UI.

attribute.name: tabIndex
attribute.description: Number (between -32767 to 32767) indicating the widget's position in the default tab flow. The value is used to set the "tabIndex" attribute on the widget's bounding box. Negative values allow the widget to receive DOM focus programmatically (by calling the focus method), while being removed from the default tab flow. A value of null removes the "tabIndex" attribute from the widget's bounding box.

Function to extract the content from the node for the indexing. The default uses the node.html(). In case if you need to index the id of the nodes, here goes one example:

Example indexing the id of the node instead of the HTML: 
function(node) {
return node.attr('id');
}

attribute.name: rendered
attribute.description: Flag indicating whether or not this Widget has been through the render lifecycle phase.

attribute.name: shim
attribute.description: Boolean flag to indicate whether or not a shim should be added to the Widgets boundingBox, to protect it from select box bleedthrough.

attribute.name: showDelay
attribute.description: Number of milliseconds after the show method is invoked to show the OverlayContext.

attribute.name: showOn
attribute.description: The event which is responsible to show the OverlayContext.

attribute.name: srcNode
attribute.description: The DOM node to parse for configuration values, passed to the Widget's HTML_PARSER definition

attribute.name: strings
attribute.description: Collection of strings used to label elements of the Widget's UI.

attribute.name: tabIndex
attribute.description: Number (between -32767 to 32767) indicating the widget's position in the default tab flow. The value is used to set the "tabIndex" attribute on the widget's bounding box. Negative values allow the widget to receive DOM focus programmatically (by calling the focus method), while being removed from the default tab flow. A value of null removes the "tabIndex" attribute from the widget's bounding box.

attribute.name: trigger
attribute.description: Node, NodeList or Selector which will be used as trigger elements to show or hide the OverlayContext.

attribute.name: visible
attribute.description: If true the OverlayContext is visible by default after the render phase. Inherited from Overlay.

attribute.name: width
attribute.description: String with units, or number, representing the width of the Widget. If a number is provided, the default unit, defined by the Widgets DEF_UNIT, property is used.

attribute.name: x
attribute.description: Page X co-ordinate for the widget. This attribute acts as a facade for the xy attribute. Changes in position can be monitored by listening for xyChange events.

attribute.name: xy
attribute.description: Page XY co-ordinate pair for the widget.

attribute.name: y
attribute.description: Page Y co-ordinate for the widget. This attribute acts as a facade for the xy attribute. Changes in position can be monitored by listening for xyChange events.

attribute.name: zIndex
attribute.description: The z-index to apply to the Widgets boundingBox. Non-numerical values for zIndex will be converted to 0

attribute.name: align
attribute.description: Inherited from Overlay.

attribute.name: anim
arrow
attribute.description: Position where the arrow will be placed. See showArrow. If it's not set, it will get the value set on the align point. Here is a list of valid arrows 'bc', 'bl', 'br', 'cc', 'lb', 'lc', 'lt', 'rb', 'rc', 'rl'.

attribute.name: bodyContent
attribute.description: The content to be added to the body section. This will replace any existing content in the body. If you want to append, or insert new content, use the setStdModContent method.

attribute.name: boundingBox
attribute.description: The outermost DOM node for the Widget, used for sizing and positioning of a Widget as well as a containing element for any decorator elements used for skinning.

attribute.name: cancellableHide
attribute.description: Cancel auto hide delay if the user interact with the Overlay (focus, click, mouseover)

attribute.name: centered
attribute.description: A convenience attribute, which can be used as a shortcut for the align attribute. If set to true, the Widget is centered in the viewport. If set to a node reference or valid selector string, the Widget will be centered within the node. If set the false, no center positioning is applied.

attribute.name: constrain
attribute.description: The node to constrain the widget's bounding box to, when setting xy. Can also be set to true, to constrain to the viewport.

attribute.name: contentBox
attribute.description: A DOM node that is a direct descendent of a Widget's bounding box that houses its content.

attribute.name: cssClass
attribute.description: CSS class to be automatically added to the boundingBox.

attribute.name: currentNode
attribute.description: OverlayContext allow multiple elements to be the trigger, the currentNode stores the current active one.

attribute.name: destroyed
attribute.description: Flag indicating whether or not this object has been through the destroy lifecycle phase.

attribute.name: disabled
attribute.description: Boolean indicating if the Widget should be disabled. The disabled implementation is left to the specific classes extending widget.

attribute.name: fillHeight
attribute.description: The section (WidgetStdMod.HEADER, WidgetStdMod.BODY or WidgetStdMod.FOOTER) which should be resized to fill the height of the standard module, when a height is set on the Widget. If a height is not set on the widget, then all sections are sized based on their content.

attribute.name: focused
attribute.description: Boolean indicating if the Widget, or one of its descendants, has focus.

attribute.name: footerContent
attribute.description: The content to be added to the footer section. This will replace any existing content in the footer. If you want to append, or insert new content, use the setStdModContent method.

attribute.name: headerContent
attribute.description: The content to be added to the header section. This will replace any existing content in the header. If you want to append, or insert new content, use the setStdModContent method.

attribute.name: height
attribute.description: String with units, or number, representing the height of the Widget. If a number is provided, the default unit, defined by the Widgets DEF_UNIT, property is used.

attribute.name: hideClass
attribute.description: css class added to hide the boundingBox when visible is set to false.

attribute.name: hideDelay
attribute.description: Number of milliseconds after the hide method is invoked to hide the OverlayContext.

attribute.name: hideOn
attribute.description: See hideOn.

attribute.name: hideOnDocumentClick
attribute.description: If true the instance is registered on the OverlayContextManager static class and will be hide when the user click on document.

attribute.name: initialized
attribute.description: Flag indicating whether or not this object has been through the init lifecycle phase.

attribute.name: preventOverlap
attribute.description: If set to true, and WidgetPositionAlign is also added to the Widget, constrained positioning will attempt to prevent the widget's bounding box from overlapping the element to which it has been aligned, by flipping the orientation of the alignment for corner based alignments

attribute.name: alwaysVisible
attribute.description: If true the Paginator will be always visible, even when the number of pages is 0. To hide the paginator controls automatically when there is no pages to display use false.

attribute.name: containers
attribute.description: The Paginator controls UI could be displayed in more than one container (i.e., in the header and footer of a list). Pass a NodeList or a selector to grab the containers.

attribute.name: destroyed
attribute.description: Flag indicating whether or not this object has been through the destroy lifecycle phase.

attribute.name: firstPageLink
attribute.description: The Node or template to be used as the first link element.

attribute.name: firstPageLinkLabel
attribute.description: The label used as content of the firstPageLink element.

attribute.name: initialized
attribute.description: Flag indicating whether or not this object has been through the init lifecycle phase.

attribute.name: lastPageLink
attribute.description: The Node or template to be used as the last link element.

attribute.name: lastPageLinkLabel
attribute.description: The label used as content of the lastPageLink element.

attribute.name: maxPageLinks
attribute.description: The max number of page links to be displayed. If lower than the total number of pages they are still navigable using next and prev links.

attribute.name: nextPageLink
attribute.description: The Node or template to be used as the next link element.

attribute.name: nextPageLinkLabel
attribute.description: The label used as content of the nextPageLink element.

attribute.name: page
attribute.description: Page to display on initial paint.

attribute.name: pageContainerTemplate
attribute.description: HTML Template for the page links container.

attribute.name: pageLinkContent
attribute.description:
Function which set the content of the each page element. The passed function receive as arguments the reference for the page element node, the page number and the index of the page element.

Example: 
function(pageEl, pageNumber, index) {
pageEl.html(pageNumber);
}

attribute.name: pageLinkTemplate
attribute.description: HTML Template for the link elements.

attribute.name: pageReportEl
attribute.description: Node element to display the page report (i.e., (1 of 100)).

attribute.name: pageReportLabelTemplate
attribute.description: Template for the pageReportEl content. Note the placeholders for the page {page} and the total pages {totalPages}.

attribute.name: prevPageLink
attribute.description: The Node or template to be used as the prev link element.

attribute.name: prevPageLinkLabel
attribute.description: The label used as content of the prevPageLink element.

attribute.name: rowsPerPage
attribute.description: Number of records constituting a "page".

attribute.name: rowsPerPageEl
attribute.description: Node element to display the rowsPerPage.

attribute.name: rowsPerPageOptions
attribute.description: Array to be displayed on the generated HTML Select element with the rowsPerPage information. (i.e., [1,3,5,7], will display these values on the select)

attribute.name: state
attribute.description: Generates information to the changeRequest event. See changeRequest.

attribute.name: template
attribute.description: Template used to render controls. The string will be used as innerHTML on all specified container nodes. Bracketed keys (e.g. {pageLinks}) in the string will be replaced with an instance of the so named ui component.

attribute.name: total
attribute.description: Total number of records to paginate through.

attribute.name: totalEl
attribute.description: Node element to display the total information.

attribute.name: totalLabel
attribute.description: The label markup to the total information.

attribute.name: totalPages
attribute.description: Number of pages. Calculated based on the total divided by the rowsPerPage.

attribute.description: Display label of the progressbar. If not specified try to query using HTML_PARSER an element inside contentBox which matches aui-progressbar-text and get its innerHTML to be used as label.

attribute.name: max
attribute.description: Represents the top value for the bar. The bar will be fully extended when reaching this value. Values higher than this will be ignored.

attribute.name: min
attribute.description: Represents the lowest value for the bar. The bar will be totally collapsed when reaching this value. Values lower than this will be ignored.

attribute.name: orientation
attribute.description: Display orientation of the progressbar (i.e. vertical or horizontal).

attribute.name: ratio
attribute.description: Calculate the ratio based on max and min values.

attribute.name: autoHide
attribute.description: False to ensure that the resize handles are always visible, true to display them only when the user mouses over the resizable borders.

attribute.name: constrain
attribute.description:
Will attempt to constrain the resize node to the boundaries. Arguments:
'view': Contrain to Viewport
'#selector_string': Constrain to this node
'{Region Object}': An Object Literal containing a valid region (top, right, bottom, left) of page positions

attribute.name: destroyed
attribute.description: Flag indicating whether or not this object has been through the destroy lifecycle phase.

attribute.name: handles
attribute.description: The handles to use (any combination of): 't', 'b', 'r', 'l', 'bl', 'br', 'tl', 'tr'. Can use a shortcut of All.

attribute.description: The maximum height of the element

attribute.name: maxWidth
attribute.description: The maximum width of the element

attribute.name: minHeight
attribute.description: The minimum height of the element

attribute.name: minWidth
attribute.description: The minimum width of the element

attribute.name: node
attribute.description: The selector or element to resize. Required.

attribute.name: preserveRatio
attribute.description: Maintain the element's ratio when resizing.

attribute.name: proxy
attribute.description: Resize a proxy element instead of the real element.

attribute.name: proxyEl
attribute.description: The Resize proxy element.

attribute.name: resizing
attribute.description: True when the element is being Resized.

attribute.name: tickX
attribute.description: The number of x ticks to span the resize to.

attribute.name: tickY
attribute.description: The number of y ticks to span the resize to.

attribute.name: wrap
attribute.description: True to wrap an element with a div if needed (required for textareas and images, defaults to false) in favor of the handles config option. The wrapper element type (default div) could be over-riden passing the wrapper attribute.

attribute.name: wrapTypes
attribute.description: Elements that requires a wrapper by default. Normally are elements which cannot have children elements.

attribute.name: wrapper
attribute.description: Element to wrap the wrapTypes. This element will house the handles elements.

attribute.name: alwaysShowContainer
attribute.description: Always show the results container, instead of only showing when the user is requesting them.

attribute.name: applyLocalFilter
attribute.description: If set to true, the filterResults method will be run on the response from the data source.

attribute.name: autoHighlight
attribute.description: Automatically highlight the first item in the list when the results are made visible.

attribute.name: boundingBox
attribute.description: The outermost DOM node for the Widget, used for sizing and positioning of a Widget as well as a containing element for any decorator elements used for skinning.

attribute.name: button
attribute.description: To use a button

attribute.name: contentBox
attribute.description: A DOM node that is a direct descendent of a Widget's bounding box that houses its content.

attribute.name: cssClass
attribute.description: CSS class to be automatically added to the boundingBox.

attribute.name: dataSource
attribute.description: The data source that results will be read from. This can either be an existing DataSource object, or it can be a value that would be passed to DataSource.

attribute.name: dataSourceType
attribute.description: The type of the data source passed into dataSource. This can be used to explicitly declare what kind of DataSource object will be created.

attribute.name: delimChar
attribute.description: The character used to indicate the beginning or ending of a new value. Most commonly used is a ",".

attribute.name: destroyed
attribute.description: Flag indicating whether or not this object has been through the destroy lifecycle phase.

attribute.name: disabled
attribute.description: Boolean indicating if the Widget should be disabled. The disabled implementation is left to the specific classes extending widget.

attribute.name: focused
attribute.description: Boolean indicating if the Widget, or one of its descendants, has focus.

attribute.name: forceSelection
attribute.description: If typeAhead is true, this will clear a selection when the overlay closes unless a user explicitly selects an item.

attribute.name: height
attribute.description: String with units, or number, representing the height of the Widget. If a number is provided, the default unit, defined by the Widgets DEF_UNIT, property is used.

attribute.name: hideClass
attribute.description: css class added to hide the boundingBox when visible is set to false.

attribute.name: initialized
attribute.description: Flag indicating whether or not this object has been through the init lifecycle phase.

attribute.name: input
attribute.description: The input field which will recieve the users input.

attribute.name: matchKey
attribute.description: The key or numeric index in the schema to match the result against.

attribute.name: maxResultsDisplayed
attribute.description: The maximum number of results to display.

attribute.name: minQueryLength
attribute.description: The minimum number of characters required to query the data source.

attribute.name: queryDelay
attribute.description: The amount of time in seconds to delay before submitting the query.

attribute.name: queryInterval
attribute.description: When IME usage is detected or interval detection is explicitly enabled, AutoComplete will detect the input value at the given interval and send a query if the value has changed.

attribute.name: queryMatchCase
attribute.description: When applyLocalFilter is true, setting this to true will match only results with the same case.

attribute.name: queryMatchContains
attribute.description: When applyLocalFilter is true, setting this to true will match results which contain the query anywhere in the text, instead of just matching just items that start with the query.

attribute.name: queryQuestionMark
attribute.description: For IO DataSources, AutoComplete will automatically insert a "?" between the server URI and the encoded query string. To prevent this behavior, you can set this value to false. If you need to customize this even further, you can override the generateRequest method.

attribute.name: render
attribute.description: If true the render phase will be autimatically invoked preventing the .render() manual call.

attribute.name: rendered
attribute.description: Flag indicating whether or not this Widget has been through the render lifecycle phase.

attribute.name: schema
attribute.description: A valid configuration object for any of DataSource schema plugins.

attribute.name: schemaType
attribute.description: A valid type of DataSource schema plugin, such as array, json, xml, etc.

attribute.name: srcNode
attribute.description: The DOM node to parse for configuration values, passed to the Widget's HTML_PARSER definition

attribute.name: strings
attribute.description: Collection of strings used to label elements of the Widget's UI.

attribute.name: suppressInputUpdate
attribute.description: Whether or not the input field should be updated with selections.

attribute.name: tabIndex
attribute.description: Number (between -32767 to 32767) indicating the widget's position in the default tab flow. The value is used to set the "tabIndex" attribute on the widget's bounding box. Negative values allow the widget to receive DOM focus programmatically (by calling the focus method), while being removed from the default tab flow. A value of null removes the "tabIndex" attribute from the widget's bounding box.

attribute.name: typeAhead
attribute.description: If autoHighlight is enabled, whether or not the input field should be automatically updated with the first result as the user types, automatically selecting the portion of the text the user has not typed yet.

attribute.name: typeAheadDelay
attribute.description: If typeAhead is true, number of seconds to delay before updating the input. In order to prevent certain race conditions, this value must always be greater than the queryDelay.

attribute.name: uniqueName
attribute.description: The unique ID of the input element.

attribute.name: visible
attribute.description: Boolean indicating weather or not the Widget is visible.

attribute.name: width
attribute.description: String with units, or number, representing the width of the Widget. If a number is provided, the default unit, defined by the Widgets DEF_UNIT, property is used.

attribute.name: boundingBox
attribute.description: The outermost DOM node for the Widget, used for sizing and positioning of a Widget as well as a containing element for any decorator elements used for skinning.

attribute.name: canReset
attribute.description: If true could be reseted (i.e., have no values selected).

attribute.name: contentBox
attribute.description: A DOM node that is a direct descendent of a Widget's bounding box that houses its content.

attribute.name: cssClass
attribute.description: CSS class to be automatically added to the boundingBox.

attribute.name: defaultSelected
attribute.description: The number of selected starts when the Rating render.

attribute.name: destroyed
attribute.description: Flag indicating whether or not this object has been through the destroy lifecycle phase.

attribute.description: Whether the Rating is disabled or not. Disabled Ratings don't allow hover or click, just display selected stars.

attribute.name: elements
attribute.description: NodeList of elements used on the Rating. Each element is one Star.

attribute.name: focused
attribute.description: Boolean indicating if the Widget, or one of its descendants, has focus.

attribute.name: height
attribute.description: String with units, or number, representing the height of the Widget. If a number is provided, the default unit, defined by the Widgets DEF_UNIT, property is used.

attribute.name: hiddenInput
attribute.description: Hidden input to handle the selected value. This hidden input replace the radio elements and keep the same name.

attribute.name: initialized
attribute.description: Flag indicating whether or not this object has been through the init lifecycle phase.

attribute.name: inputName
attribute.description: Name of the hiddenInput element. If not specified will use the name of the replaced radio.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: Label to be displayed with the Rating elements.

attribute.name: labelNode
attribute.description: DOM Node to display the text of the StarRating. If not specified try to query using HTML_PARSER an element inside boundingBox which matches aui-rating-label-element.

attribute.name: render
attribute.description: If true the render phase will be autimatically invoked preventing the .render() manual call.

attribute.name: rendered
attribute.description: Flag indicating whether or not this Widget has been through the render lifecycle phase.

attribute.name: selectedIndex
attribute.description: Stores the index of the selected element.

attribute.name: showTitle
attribute.description: If true will extract the value of the title attribute on the radio, and use it on the generated Rating elements.

attribute.name: size
attribute.description: The size on ThumbRating is always 2 (i.e., thumb up and thumb down).

attribute.description: If set, will be used when there is no DOM title on the radio elements.

attribute.name: bodyContent
attribute.description: The content to be added to the body section. This will replace any existing content in the body. If you want to append, or insert new content, use the setStdModContent method.

attribute.description: The outermost DOM node for the Widget, used for sizing and positioning of a Widget as well as a containing element for any decorator elements used for skinning.

attribute.name: cancellableHide
attribute.description: Cancel auto hide delay if the user interact with the Overlay (focus, click, mouseover)

attribute.name: centered
attribute.description: A convenience attribute, which can be used as a shortcut for the align attribute. If set to true, the Widget is centered in the viewport. If set to a node reference or valid selector string, the Widget will be centered within the node. If set the false, no center positioning is applied.

attribute.name: constrain
attribute.description: The node to constrain the widget's bounding box to, when setting xy. Can also be set to true, to constrain to the viewport.

attribute.description: OverlayContext allow multiple elements to be the trigger, the currentNode stores the current active one.

attribute.description: Boolean indicating if the Widget should be disabled. The disabled implementation is left to the specific classes extending widget.

attribute.description: The section (WidgetStdMod.HEADER, WidgetStdMod.BODY or WidgetStdMod.FOOTER) which should be resized to fill the height of the standard module, when a height is set on the Widget. If a height is not set on the widget, then all sections are sized based on their content.

attribute.name: focused

attribute.name: footerContent
attribute.description: The content to be added to the footer section. This will replace any existing content in the footer. If you want to append, or insert new content, use the setStdModContent method.

attribute.name: headerContent
attribute.description: The content to be added to the header section. This will replace any existing content in the header. If you want to append, or insert new content, use the setStdModContent method.

attribute.name: preventOverlap
attribute.description: If set to true, and WidgetPositionAlign is also added to the Widget, constrained positioning will attempt to prevent the widget's bounding box from overlapping the element to which it has been aligned, by flipping the orientation of the alignment for corner based alignments
